meanings.definition: Relating to or being a muscle that contracts without external nerve stimulation.
meanings.sent1: The myogenic muscle in the heart beats on its own without needing signals from nerves.
meanings.sent2: The myogenic nature of the muscle allows it to contract independently.
meanings.sent3: The myogenic muscle decided to dance to its own rhythm, ignoring the nerve signals.
meanings.sent4: Her myogenic strength was like a silent drummer, pulsing with its own beat.
meanings.sent5: The myogenic muscle's ability to contract spontaneously is truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: The myogenic cells were found to have originated from muscle tissue.
meanings.sent2: The myogenic process begins within the muscle tissue itself.
meanings.sent3: The myogenic origin of the growth surprised the researchers, as it was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: His myogenic creativity stemmed from deep within his muscle tissue, fueling his art.
meanings.sent5: The myogenic source of energy within the muscle tissue was a fascinating discovery.
